title: UK parliamentary system limits judicial review

content.question: The use of judicial review in the United Kingdom is limited because

choices.label: the United Kingdom lacks a written constitution
judicial review is seen as violating the principle of parliamentary sovereignty
the United Kingdom is a unitary state
the United Kingdom lacks a system of checks and balances
legal systems in the United Kingdom are structured on common law

content.answer: judicial review is seen as violating the principle of parliamentary sovereignty

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
